content: Essay surgery revelation: 'A lot of the essay is about your parents. But the main focus should be you.' Jenny identifies core problem in 16 minutes, discovers robot-to-robotics arc by minute 40. Complete narrative restructure from parent story to personal journey saves potentially losing application.

Robot-to-robotics progression strategy: 7-year-old with Jimu Robot → middle school Vex Robotics → high school game development → Empowering AI nonprofit founder. Linear complexity increase demonstrates growth. Bookends with 'inspire younger girls like my 7-year-old self.'

Surgical editing technique: Cut sentences not words for flow. Delete irrelevant details (true crime TV, cooking). Parent story reduced to 2 sentences max. Transform 'I felt that I inherited' to 'I inherited.' Word economy maintains meaning while hitting 250-word limit.

silver_bullet.content: Sister college milestone acknowledged: 'We just dropped off my sister.' Jenny shows interest in family life before work. WiFi issues shared vulnerably. Creates safe space for major essay restructuring without defensiveness.

Real-time narrative pivot executed: Minute 16 identifies parent focus problem, minute 40 discovers robot story, minute 45 restructures entire essay, minute 52 new framework complete. Essay salvaged through strategic preservation and deletion.

Bookending narrative framework: Open with 'I eagerly ripped open the packaging of the robot,' close with 'inspire younger girls like my 7-year-old self.' Circular structure creates satisfaction. Rough draft permission: 'This is very rough, make it sound like you.'

Session outcomes: Essay transformed from parent-focused to personal journey, word count reduced from over 250 to 225 with room for details, YouTube video finally exporting, game dialogue system implemented, React learning started for websites.

Screen-sharing surgical editing: Live deletions visible real-time, collaborative typing simultaneously, original saved before edits. Verbal-to-written technique: Huda narrates robot story, Jenny types, natural voice emerges.

Jenny shares own NCWIT struggle: '500 words cut to 250 for my essay.' Topics included social media inclusivity, mental health AI. Message: Everyone faces word limits. Technical difficulties normalized: WiFi issues at Stanford too.

Parent story extraction technique: 'While inspiring, doesn't showcase you.' Acknowledge value but relocate to 2 sentences max. Student agency throughout narrative. Transforms weak parent-dependent essay into strong personal journey showcasing continuous growth.
